metadata.name: The Intact Man - Special Single Edition
metadata.description:
The Intact Man is a short story written in poetic prose. Inspired by the poem The Machine of the World by Brazilian poet Carlos Drummond de Andrade. Between symbolism and poetry, the first-person narrative traces the nuances of life, addresses the relationships and encounters that form each one. Being intact means remaining indifferent to the world, on the other hand, being open to exchange and encounter brings out the beauty and fragility that makes us human beings capable of exchanging feelings and affections.

Illustrations are made with AI using text as a prompt. The illustrations are inspired by the style of painter Edward Hopper. They carry a solitary and anonymous atmosphere. Throughout the story the illustrations gradually change style, reflecting the protagonist's internal conflicts as the narrative progresses.

This first edition 1/1 contains in the metadata the folder stored in Arweave  
        - PDF file  
        - MP4 file  
        - Folder with all pages in JPG 3000 pixels (including the 12 illustrations)  
        - Special Item - Hand autographed cover
